page.title: 01DONCASTER'S CARR LAND
page.content: {LANDSCAPE}An area to the South and West of the town, generally below 25ft made up of clay and peat. It is wetland with rough pasture and industrial waste. As it rises S.W. to the magnesian limestone there are arable farms. {COMMUNICATIONS} The area is crossed by major East/West routes: A630, M18. The central part contains many disused B.R marshalling yards and a landing strip for light aircraft. {INDUSTRY }The Carr Hill Estate runs through the area and contains metal engineering and manufacturing firms. {RESIDENTIAL}All in the West and North: Alverley Estate (private), Woodfield (local authority), Balby(private/L.A.) {RECREATION}Golf course, youth club, nature reserve, W.M.C., pubs. {SERVICES}Schools, post office, bus service, shops.
